repnme.cdata!: Romania - Social Protection Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Protection
            Adjustment Loan (SPAL) Project for Romania are: outcomes of
            the project are satisfactory, and the performance of the
            Bank and the Borrower is also rated as satisfactory. Some of
            the lessons learned from the project are: a) disbursement of
            the whole amount of the loan in one tranche instead of two
            or more was recognized as risky since there would be no
            leverage for follow up. However, the risk was mitigated by
            sufficiently front-loading the conditions of Board
            presentation and by the demonstrated commitment of the
            Government in meeting the conditions of Board presentation;
            and b) another risk related to weak implementation capacity
            of the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection (MOLSP) , the
            main agency of the Government responsible for follow up. In
            addition, the loan was for general fiscal and balance of
            payments support, and was not disbursed to the MOLSP's
            budget. However, this risk was mitigated by the fact that
            the ongoing Employment and Social Protection Project (ESPP)
            was restructured to support the MOLSP in implementing the
            SPAL follow-up actions. The Bank project team put extra
            emphasis on supervision of the ESPP to assist the MOLSP in
            implementing follow-up actions.

repnme.cdata!: Romania - Social Protection Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Social Projection
            Adjustment Loan Project is to support the Romanian
            Government's efforts to strengthen the social
            protection program. This program has been developed to
            assist the most vulnerable groups of society who will suffer
            from the negative income effects of macro-economic
            stabilization and structure reform measures to be carried
            out throughout 1997/1998. The project, consisting of a
            single tranche, will provide financial support for the
            Government's social protection program. This program
            includes: child allowances, agricultural pensions, a minimum
            income guarantee scheme, social feeding programs,
            educational social protection, temporary income support, and
            lifeline rates for electricity.
